transport what is what do we see the opportunity the challenges and I guess
the first thing that we see is that live video remains a critical component of
broadcast programming particularly for things like sports and news there is a
live content will monetize very well customers are very interested in watching it it's a very important part
of an overall broadcast experience it's also something that where operators need
robust secure live video transport so because this is your highest value content it's the key sporting match or
the latest breaking news or a 24 by 7 channel operators need to understand
that that's gonna be moved from place to place reliably and securely this is part
of a general trend to what we see here at AWS of moving broadcast workflows to the cloud but that cloud is also letting
customers be more nimble in their business models so with the cloud you
can move into broader geographical audiences with your live content it's no longer a model where if you have a
sporting event in a particular market you're limited to distribution in that
in that market the cloud lets you distribute that that video stream that
live video stream all over the world if you can do it reliably if you can do it
securely if you can do it in a cost-effective manner so there were two ways that operators
typically manage these challenges or manage this problem and they both have
challenges so the traditional way was to go to an infrastructure provider you
would go to someone who provide a managed network maybe it's a fiber network maybe it's a satellite network and you'd provision some fixed amount of
capacity this was secure and reliable but it was slow to set up they had fixed
geographic coverage and limited capacity so if you wanted to spin up a video
stream for a new new business that you maybe want to try and experiment with it
wasn't a great fit the practical ability to be nimble try new things
scale up scaled down all of the things we tend to talk about here in AWS just was hard to achieve with a traditional
fiber network or a traditional satellite connection so some customers went to self managed IP solutions and these had
you know the characteristics of nimbleness that that we're talking about here today
but the customer needed to deploy configure and maintain what could be fairly complex systems they were
required to work with frequently multiple vendors to create a complete end-to-end solution to move
video from point to point and they needed to build or adds features like
security and sharing that was the customer's responsibility so it was hard
it was hard to do effectively so we asked ourselves could we confine the
security and reliability of a satellite or a managed fiber network with the nimbleness that you get from IP
transport and combined it into a single product and that was the motivation for
elemental media connect so what is media connect Media Connect is a reliable
secure and flexible transport service for live video that enables customers to
build transformation and global distribution workflows quickly and effectively let's talk a little bit more
about what that means we see really two workflows that customers will address
with this solution the first is Contribution workflows these are workflows that where customers
need to reliably ingest video live video data into the AWS network for video
processing or downstream processing so for example you
might have a production truck at an event site or you might have a studio
facility where you need to get video in remote affiliates get video into AWS AWS
elemental media Connect is a tool that allows you to do that securely reliably and cost-effectively the second thing is
distribution workflows so these are workflows where customers need to distribute a live video stream both
inside and outside the AWS network so inside could be multiple distribution
points within your AWS account so we have customers who are looking at using this to send different paths for for
reliability or redundancy different processing chains or it could be to
another region so I want to take a video feed that I am sourcing in the EU and
send it to the US for downstream processing and distribution or it could
be to another customers account so you could send video from your your AWS account to
others or it could be just destinations outside the AWS Network so we anticipate
that customers will use AWS elemental Media Connect for both contribution and
distribution workflows let's look at some of the key capabilities I'm gonna
turn things over here to David who is going to take you through this in more detail thanks Alex

number one of course is reliability we
recognize you know IP UDP IP particularly isn't inherently reliable

mezzanine live video service security is

connect will support AAS industry standard encryption end-to-end that's right from your contribution encoder

key depth so when we talk about agility we're really talking about all of that

want this to be in many ways the contrast of an experience you might have

pay-as-you-go quick to deploy build an international distribution network in a few clicks in a few minutes not weeks

that's important we're talking about IP delivery of video and we need to know

on-premises encoders feeding to media connect flows which are easy aligned

deal with content sharing so one of the things that we've done or I've talked about so far have been very kind of
deliberate very active I've decided I'm sending content to this IP address or I'm sending content to this media live
instance what entitlements are designed to do is to deal with when you have the need to share content with a partner for
example and so entitlements are really about content sharing with third parties
or internally and it works like this it's a it's a it's an originator subscriber model and so an entitlement
you you create against an existing flow now remember the flow is a one-in
construct so it represents something could be a channel could be an event but it's something and so you create an
entire against that flow that says this AWS account holder has the right to
subscribe to my content and so it looks a little bit like this here we are we call it the originators account it could
be a Content owner but it's someone who has the rights to distribute that content they create the entitlement
against their media connect flow and then at a later stage completely
decoupled from the the granting of the entitlement the subscriber comes in goes
into their own account creates their own flow in the same region as the originators flow and takes advantage of
that talent they'll actually see it more show a little demo of that in a bit here but you actually see the entitlement in the list you select it and at that point
we connect the dots between the two flows and content starts to flow between the two so it's a really I think very
powerful concept it's simple in nature but really gives you a lot of flexibility when it comes to content
sharing with third parties and partners a couple of things I really like to point out about this things I think are
really great about this one there's that whole decoupling of that subscriber originate a relationship you set up the
